subject: Re: [junit] Getting the Testing Bug
msgSnippet: ... From a choir-member perspective -- great job!  Thanks for the link. -- Jason Rogers So great is the ignorance, so very little the knowledge, of even the
messageBody:
On Thu, 22 Jan 2004 16:27:18 -0700, Mike Clark <mike@...> wrote:

> Howdy,
>
> It's probably preaching to the choir on this list, but java.net has
> published my article titled "A Dozen Ways to Get the Testing Bug in the
> New Year":
>
> http://today.java.net/pub/a/today/2004/01/22/DozenWays.html
>
> It gives you 12 practical ways to start (and keep) writing JUnit tests,
> regardless of your development process. It also explains how writing
> tests first results in the emergence of better designs. I hope you find
> it helpful and encouraging.

From a choir-member perspective -- great job! Thanks for the link.

--
Jason Rogers

"So great is the ignorance, so very little the knowledge, of even the best
of men!" - John Wesley, "Christian Perfection"
